newsitem.title: JAPAN: Daiichi Kyoken says to merge with Gakuikusha.
newsitem.headline: Daiichi Kyoken says to merge with Gakuikusha.

text.p: Japanese operator of cram schools Dai-Ichi Kyoken Co Ltd said on Friday that it had agreed to merge with Gakukikusha Co Ltd, which manages preparatory schools.
A Dai-Ichi Kyoken official could not immediately give further details on the planned merger.
"It is true that we have agreed to merge with Gakuikusha," the company official said, without specifying the possible date for the merger or other details.
Gakuikusha meanwhile said in a statement that the company plans to hold a news conference in Tokyo on the planned merger with Osaka-based Dai-Ichi Kyoken at 11.30 a.m. (0230 GMT).

Earlier, the Japan Securities Dealers Association (JSDA) said it would temporarily suspend trading of the firms' shares, which are registered on the over-the-counter market, in order to confirm information which could affect investment decisions.
On Thursday, Dai-Ichi Kyoken shares ended the session at 624 yen, while Gakuikusha stood at 740 yen at the close.

The financial daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported on Friday that the two companies had agreed to merge by spring 1998 in order to strengthen business in the increasingly competitive education industry at home. The two firms have had a business tie-up since April, when Dai-Ichi Kyoken obtained 10 percent of exsisting shares of Gakuikusha.
